p: Primary Skills: Data Science, R programming, SQL, Snowflake
p.5: NOTE: Role open to Women Back to Work candidates with a career gap

strong: Work with the best in the Industry!

li: Design tools and algorithms for evidence needs of HEOR and Global Access, Value & Economics (GAVE).
li.1: Performs analyses of large healthcare databases (e.g., insurance claims, electronic medical records).
li.2: Hosting retrieve, maintain, and update large databases. Work with Database Engineering and Analysis (DE&A) team for hosting the external large database in house.
li.3: Develop, validate, and document programming for different algorithms in RWD database assets and Develop, manage, and track the Snowflake, SQL, R code banks.
li.4: Training and education of analytical infrastructure and RWD assets for new hires and Work with regional GAVE, Market Access & Customer Analytics (MACA), HEOR teams to identify RWD in support of research strategy in region.

li: Masters degree in computer science, data science, mathematics, health economics, epidemiology, biostatistics, statistics, or related field.
li.1: A minimum of 4 years of hands-on experience in statistical programing (R, SQL) and cloud-based data warehouse (e.g., Snowflake).
li.2: Experience of handling large databases. Knowledge of hospital and claims databases.
li.3: Experience in building analytical tools in R and R Shiny. Proficient in SQL and R, experience in R Shiny is also preferred.
li.4: Experience in designing the documentation framework and delivering clear, easy-to-follow data, variable, and code documentation files.
